notes: These packets are pre-POC designs for external lab discussion, not final SOPs.
All experiments require institution-specific biosafety, GMO, and permit review before execution.
Vendor catalogs and availability should be revalidated at ordering time.

experiments.title: Integrated Transcriptomics to Identify Novel TET2-CHIP Cardiovascular Targets
experiments.maps_to_problem_statement: The transcriptomic approaches fail to identify and validate novel therapeutic targets beyond already known markers like CXCL2/3 and IL8
experiments.maps_to_sub_question: What are the novel, previously unidentified molecular targets revealed by integrated transcriptomic analysis of TET2-CHIP-mediated cardiovascular disease?
experiments.objective: To identify and validate previously unreported molecular targets driving TET2-CHIP-mediated cardiovascular inflammation through bulk and single-cell RNA-seq with orthogonal validation.
readouts: Primary: Differentially expressed genes (DEGs) in TET2-deficient vs wildtype macrophages with |log2FC| >1.5 and FDR <0.05, excluding known markers (CXCL2/3, IL8)
Secondary: Single-cell RNA-seq cluster-specific expression profiles identifying cell-type-specific novel targets
Secondary: qPCR validation (≥3-fold change) and protein expression confirmation (≥2-fold change by Western/ELISA) for top 10 candidates

design.overview: Generate TET2-KO and WT bone marrow-derived macrophages from atherosclerotic mouse models, perform bulk and scRNA-seq, computationally filter known targets, validate top novel candidates by qPCR and protein analysis in vitro and in vivo.
work_packages: WP1: Generate TET2-KO and WT BMDMs from Ldlr-/- mice (n=6/group), stimulate with oxLDL (50 μg/mL, 24h), harvest for bulk RNA-seq (n=4) and scRNA-seq (n=2 pooled samples)

WP2: Bulk RNA-seq analysis (DESeq2), scRNA-seq analysis (Seurat), literature mining to exclude known CHIP/CVD markers, integrate datasets to prioritize top 10 novel targets based on expression magnitude, consistency, and druggability prediction
WP3: Validate top 10 candidates by qPCR in independent BMDM samples (n=6/group, TET2-KO vs WT, ±oxLDL), confirm protein expression for top 5 by Western blot and ELISA in cell lysates and supernatants

WP4: Validate top 3 targets in vivo using aortic arch samples from TET2-CHIP atherosclerosis model (Tet2+/- Ldlr-/-, n=8/group vs WT controls), perform quality control, statistical analysis, and pathway enrichment
controls: Positive control: Known markers CXCL2, CXCL3, IL8 expression validated by qPCR and protein assays to confirm system responsiveness
Negative control: Unstimulated wildtype BMDMs to establish baseline expression levels
Technical control: RNA quality (RIN >8.0), sequencing depth (>30M reads/sample bulk, >5000 cells scRNA-seq), isotype controls for protein assays
design.sample_size_plan: Bulk RNA-seq: n=4 biological replicates per condition (TET2-KO+oxLDL, WT+oxLDL); scRNA-seq: n=2 pooled samples (3 mice each) per condition targeting 10,000 cells; qPCR validation: n=6 independent BMDM preparations; Western/ELISA: n=6; in vivo validation: n=8 mice per genotype
success_criteria: Identification of ≥20 novel DEGs (not CXCL2/3, IL8, or other reported CHIP/CVD markers) with |log2FC| >1.5, FDR <0.05 in bulk RNA-seq, and corroboration in scRNA-seq
≥5 of top 10 candidates validate by qPCR with ≥3-fold change (p<0.05) and ≥2 validate at protein level with ≥2-fold change (p<0.05)
≥1 top target validates in vivo with ≥2-fold change in aortic tissue (p<0.05) between TET2-deficient and WT atherosclerotic mice

materials.purpose: Generate TET2-KO BMDMs via Cre-lox system
Atherosclerosis-prone background for CHIP model
Differentiate bone marrow cells to macrophages
Inflammatory stimulus for atherosclerotic conditions
RNA extraction for bulk and validation experiments
RNA cleanup and quality improvement

materials.item: TruSeq Stranded mRNA Library Prep Kit
materials.purpose: Bulk RNA-seq library preparation

materials.item: Chromium Single Cell 3' GEX Kit v3.1
materials.purpose: Single-cell RNA-seq library preparation
High-throughput sequencing for bulk and scRNA-seq
cDNA synthesis for qPCR validation
qPCR quantification of candidate targets

materials.item: Custom TaqMan primers for novel targets
materials.purpose: High-specificity qPCR validation
Protein quantification for Western blots
Western blot protein separation

materials.item: Custom primary antibodies for novel targets
materials.purpose: Protein detection by Western blot

materials.item: Mouse ELISA kits (custom for top targets)
materials.purpose: Quantify secreted protein levels
RNA quality assessment (RIN determination)
scRNA-seq data processing and alignment

estimated_direct_cost_usd.scope: Includes sequencing services ($15-20K), library prep kits ($5-8K), animal costs ($3-5K), validation reagents including custom primers/antibodies ($4-7K), and consumables ($1-2K). Excludes personnel, equipment depreciation, and institutional overhead.

protocol_references.title: Fuster et al. (2017) Clonal hematopoiesis associated with TET2 deficiency accelerates atherosclerosis development in mice. Science 355:842-847
protocol_references.use: Reference CHIP-CVD mouse model generation, BMDM isolation protocols, and atherosclerosis induction parameters

protocol_references.title: Jaiswal et al. (2017) Clonal Hematopoiesis and Risk of Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease. NEJM 377:111-121
protocol_references.use: Establish clinical relevance and known CHIP-CVD markers to exclude from novel target identification

protocol_references.title: Zheng et al. (2017) Massively parallel digital transcriptional profiling of single cells. Nat Commun 8:14049
protocol_references.use: 10x Genomics scRNA-seq protocol optimization and best practices for quality control

protocol_references.title: Love et al. (2014) Moderated estimation of fold change and dispersion for RNA-seq data with DESeq2. Genome Biol 15:550
protocol_references.use: Statistical framework for differential expression analysis with appropriate normalization and FDR control

protocol_references.title: Stuart et al. (2019) Comprehensive Integration of Single-Cell Data. Cell 177:1888-1902
protocol_references.use: Seurat workflow for scRNA-seq analysis including clustering, cell type identification, and integration with bulk data

protocol_references.title: Bustin et al. (2009) The MIQE Guidelines: Minimum Information for Publication of Quantitative Real-Time PCR Experiments. Clin Chem 55:611-622
protocol_references.use: Standardized qPCR validation protocols including primer design, normalization strategy, and statistical analysis

handoff_package_for_lab: Comprehensive literature review document identifying all known CHIP-CVD markers (CXCL2/3, IL8, TNFα, IL1β, IL6, CCL2, etc.) with PubMed IDs for computational filtering, minimum 50 genes compiled
Approved IACUC protocol number and breeding strategy for generating Tet2+/- or Tet2-/- on Ldlr-/- background, including timeline for sufficient cohort generation

Bioinformatics pipeline specification including software versions (DESeq2 v1.38+, Seurat v4.3+, R v4.2+), server access credentials, and analysis scripts for reproducible DEG identification with literature-based filtering
Pre-validated primer sequences for positive control genes (Cxcl2, Cxcl3, Il8/Cxcl8 mouse ortholog, Gapdh, Actb) with demonstrated efficiency 90-110%
Vendor quotes for bulk RNA-seq (30M reads/sample, n=8) and scRNA-seq (targeting 10K cells/sample, n=4) services with confirmed turnaround time
Druggability screening criteria and database access (DrugBank, ChEMBL) for prioritizing targets with therapeutic potential in computational ranking

experiments.title: Cell Density and Viability Validation for Lucifer Yellow Dye Transfer Assay
experiments.maps_to_problem_statement: Lucifer Yellow dye transfer assay lacks essential controls (cell density, viability) and shows unexplained discrepancy where mutant has less dye but comparable migration distance to control
experiments.maps_to_sub_question: Are cell density and viability comparable between control and mutant groups in the dye transfer assay?
experiments.objective: To quantify and compare cell density and viability between control and mutant cell populations at the time of Lucifer Yellow dye transfer assays.
readouts: Primary: Cell density (cells/mm²) measured by automated nuclei counting in control vs. mutant cultures
Secondary: Cell viability percentage measured by live/dead fluorescence staining (calcein-AM/ethidium homodimer)
Secondary: Metabolic activity (MTT absorbance at 570nm) normalized to cell number
Secondary: Apoptotic cell percentage measured by Annexin V-FITC/PI flow cytometry

design.overview: Culture control and mutant cells under identical conditions as the original dye transfer experiments, then quantify cell density by automated nuclei counting and assess viability by three orthogonal methods (live/dead imaging, MTT metabolic assay, and Annexin V flow cytometry) at the exact timepoint when dye transfer would be performed.
work_packages: WP1: Establish standardized cell culture protocol matching original dye transfer conditions - seed control and mutant cells at defined densities, culture for same duration as dye transfer experiments, collect samples at 0h, 24h, 48h, and 72h timepoints

WP2: Automated cell density quantification - fix cells, perform DAPI nuclear staining, image 10 fields per well using automated microscopy, analyze with ImageJ particle counting to determine cells/mm²

WP3: Multi-method viability assessment - perform live/dead staining (calcein-AM/EthD-1) with fluorescence imaging, MTT assay with spectrophotometry, and Annexin V-FITC/PI flow cytometry on parallel samples

WP4: Statistical analysis and correlation - perform two-way ANOVA (genotype × timepoint), calculate coefficient of variation within groups, correlate viability metrics with original dye transfer data, generate standardized report with quality control metrics
controls: Positive control for cell death: treat subset of control cells with 70% methanol for 10 minutes to induce complete cell death, verify viability assays detect 0% viability
Negative control for counting artifacts: image and analyze cell-free wells with media only to establish background threshold for automated counting
Technical control for metabolic assay: include wells with known cell numbers (5,000, 10,000, 20,000 cells) to generate standard curve and verify linear MTT response range
design.sample_size_plan: N=6 biological replicates per genotype (control and mutant) per timepoint (4 timepoints), with 3 technical replicates per assay method, total of 48 culture wells; for flow cytometry, analyze 10,000 events per sample; for imaging, capture 10 fields per well (0.9 mm² each)
success_criteria: Cell density measurements show coefficient of variation <15% within genotype groups and automated counting correlation with manual counts r²>0.95
If cell density differs between genotypes by >20% or viability differs by >10% at dye transfer timepoint, these are identified as confounding variables requiring experimental redesign
All three viability assays (live/dead, MTT, Annexin V) show concordance within 10% for same samples, validating measurement reliability

materials.item: LIVE/DEAD Viability/Cytotoxicity Kit for mammalian cells
materials.purpose: Simultaneous fluorescence-based measurement of live cells (calcein-AM) and dead cells (ethidium homodimer-1)
Colorimetric assay for metabolic activity/viability

materials.item: FITC Annexin V Apoptosis Detection Kit with PI
materials.purpose: Flow cytometry detection of apoptotic (Annexin V+) and necrotic (PI+) cells
Nuclear counterstain for automated cell counting
Culture vessel for fluorescence-based assays with minimal background
Culture vessel for MTT absorbance assay
Cell fixation for immunofluorescence and counting

materials.item: Countess II FL Automated Cell Counter
materials.purpose: Initial cell seeding standardization and validation of automated counting
Standard culture vessel matching original dye transfer experimental setup
Manual cell counting viability assessment at seeding

estimated_direct_cost_usd.scope: Includes all reagent kits, plates, and consumables for the described experiment. Excludes equipment costs (microscope, flow cytometer, plate reader assumed available), cell culture media, and personnel costs. High estimate includes additional replicates and troubleshooting reagents.

protocol_references.title: Papadopoulos NG, et al. An improved fluorescence assay for the determination of lymphocyte-mediated cytotoxicity using flow cytometry. J Immunol Methods. 1994;177(1-2):101-11
protocol_references.use: Establishes validated flow cytometry gating strategy for Annexin V/PI discrimination of live, apoptotic, and necrotic cell populations

protocol_references.title: Riss TL, et al. Cell Viability Assays. Assay Guidance Manual [Internet]. Bethesda (MD): Eli Lilly & Company and the National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences; 2004-2016
protocol_references.use: Provides comprehensive guidance on MTT assay optimization, linear range determination, and appropriate controls for metabolic viability assessment

protocol_references.title: Decrock E, et al. Transfer of IP3 through gap junctions is critical, but not sufficient, for the spread of apoptosis. Cell Death Differ. 2012;19(6):947-57
protocol_references.use: Demonstrates integrated approach to measuring gap junction communication and cell viability/apoptosis in parallel, relevant for experimental design

protocol_references.title: Schneider CA, Rasband WS, Eliceiri KW. NIH Image to ImageJ: 25 years of image analysis. Nat Methods. 2012;9(7):671-5
protocol_references.use: Technical reference for automated cell counting using ImageJ nuclei segmentation and particle analysis tools

handoff_package_for_lab: Detailed cell culture protocol from original Lucifer Yellow dye transfer experiments including: cell line identities, passage numbers used, seeding density, culture duration, media formulation, and exact timing of dye injection relative to plating

Microscope specifications and imaging parameters: objective magnification, numerical aperture, camera pixel size, field of view dimensions, and exposure settings to enable proper calibration of cell density measurements (cells/mm²)

Original dye transfer experimental data including: number of replicates performed, passage number ranges, any observations about cell morphology or confluence differences, and raw data on dye transfer distances and fluorescence intensities for correlation analysis

Standard operating procedures for handling the specific control and mutant cell lines including: optimal seeding densities, splitting ratios, freezing/thawing protocols, and any known growth rate differences or special culture requirements

experiments.title: Edit Transformation-Competence Determinants in Recalcitrant Bioenergy Crop Genotypes
experiments.maps_to_problem_statement: Genotype-specific transformation efficiency differences are driven by unknown underlying genetic or epigenetic variation, preventing widespread adoption of plant engineering in non-elite lines.
experiments.maps_to_sub_question: Can identified genetic or epigenetic determinants of transformation competence be edited to convert recalcitrant elite lines into transformable lines?
experiments.objective: Test whether targeted editing of candidate competence loci increases Agrobacterium-mediated transformation efficiency in recalcitrant lines.
readouts: Primary: stable transformation efficiency = PCR-positive independent events / immature embryos treated
Secondary: event quality (copy number, backbone integration, edit genotype at target loci)
Secondary: regeneration rate and fertility in T0/T1

design.overview: Parallel construct and transformation study across one transformable control genotype and two recalcitrant genotypes, with multiplex CRISPR edits to top-ranked candidate loci.
work_packages: WP1 candidate selection: choose 8-12 loci from prior omics/QTL literature and internal pilot data
WP2 construct build: 3-4 multiplex CRISPR constructs plus non-targeting control
WP3 Agrobacterium transformation: immature embryos or embryogenic callus using a validated sorghum/switchgrass protocol
WP4 selection and regeneration under hygromycin
WP5 molecular QC: targeted amplicon sequencing, transgene PCR/qPCR copy number, backbone check
WP6 statistics: mixed-effects model of transformation efficiency by genotype and construct
controls: Transformable genotype positive process control (e.g., TX430-like line)
Recalcitrant genotype + empty/non-targeting construct negative control
No-Agrobacterium contamination control on selection media
design.sample_size_plan: Per construct per genotype: 120 immature embryos, 3 biological replicates (total ~1080 embryos for 3 genotypes x 3 constructs x 120).
success_criteria: >=2x increase in stable transformation efficiency in >=1 recalcitrant genotype vs matched non-targeting control
No major regeneration penalty (>25% drop) compared with control
At least 30% of positive events show intended edit at one or more target loci

materials.item: Agrobacterium helper/host system (GV3101:pMP90RK or equivalent validated plant transformation strain)
materials.purpose: Binary vector delivery into plant tissue
CRISPR cassette and selectable marker backbone
Guide design and synthesis for locus editing

materials.item: Murashige and Skoog basal medium with vitamins
materials.purpose: Core plant tissue culture medium
Vir gene induction to enhance Agrobacterium transfer
Regeneration medium hormone component
Callus/rooting medium hormone component
Selection of transformed plant tissue
Genotyping and transgene QC
Copy number and marker-qPCR assays

estimated_direct_cost_usd.scope: Consumables + standard molecular assays; excludes labor, sequencing core overhead, greenhouse costs, and major equipment

protocol_references.title: Optimized Agrobacterium-mediated sorghum transformation protocol
protocol_references.use: Transformation benchmarking and event quality expectations

protocol_references.title: Agrobacterium-mediated sorghum transformation (Methods Mol Biol)
protocol_references.use: Step-level sorghum transformation guidance

protocol_references.title: Switchgrass cell-suspension transformation with GV3101
protocol_references.use: Switchgrass-compatible high-throughput workflow

protocol_references.title: Simple efficient switchgrass Agrobacterium protocol
protocol_references.use: Coculture parameters and acetosyringone usage range

handoff_package_for_lab: Target locus list and gRNA sequences
Construct maps and cloning strategy
Per-genotype tissue source and stage criteria
Transformation and regeneration media recipes
QC assay primer list and acceptance thresholds
Statistical analysis plan template

experiments.title: Validate Safe-Harbor Loci and Insulator Sequences for Stable Transgene Expression in Bioenergy Crops
experiments.maps_to_problem_statement: How promoters, enhancers, and cis-regulatory elements (CREs) impact position effects of transgene insertions in bioenergy crops is not understood, and sequences with insulator-like function to dampen ectopic interactions are needed.
experiments.maps_to_sub_question: Can validated safe harbor loci be identified in bioenergy crop genomes for predictable transgene expression?
experiments.objective: Identify insertion sites and boundary elements that produce high, stable, low-variance expression across tissues and generations.
readouts: Primary: reporter mean expression and coefficient of variation across independent events
Primary: expression stability across tissues and T1 generation
Secondary: insertion fidelity and copy number
Secondary: growth/fitness neutrality

design.overview: Head-to-head targeted insertion experiment comparing 3 candidate safe-harbor loci and 2 insulator configurations using a dual-luciferase reporter cassette.
work_packages: WP1 candidate loci nomination from pan-genome and chromatin context
WP2 build cassettes: no-insulator, insulator-A, insulator-B
WP3 CRISPR-directed insertion into each candidate locus
WP4 random-integration comparator arm (standard Agrobacterium transformation)
WP5 expression profiling by dual-luciferase and qPCR in controlled growth conditions
WP6 multi-tissue and generation follow-up (T0 leaf/callus + T1 seedling tissues)
controls: Random integration arm as baseline position-effect comparator
No-insulator cassette at each candidate locus
Constitutive internal Renilla control for ratiometric normalization
design.sample_size_plan: Target >=12 independent insertion events per locus x insulator condition; minimum 3 technical assay replicates per tissue per line.
success_criteria: >=30% reduction in between-line expression CV versus random integration baseline
No significant drop in mean expression vs no-insulator comparator at same locus
Stable expression rank order maintained in T1 (Spearman rho >=0.7)

materials.purpose: Targeted insertion donor and reporter cassette backbone
Ratiometric reporter quantification

materials.item: Firefly/Renilla reporter vectors (for cassette assembly controls)
materials.purpose: Reference reporter constructs and assay controls
Guide synthesis for locus-targeted insertion
Transformation delivery strain

materials.item: Murashige and Skoog basal medium with vitamins
materials.purpose: Plant tissue culture and regeneration
Agrobacterium vir induction
Selection of transformed lines
Insertion-site and copy-number QC

estimated_direct_cost_usd.scope: Consumables + reporter assays + routine molecular QC; excludes labor, greenhouse, and high-depth sequencing

protocol_references.title: Marker-free targeted insertion at plant genomic safe harbors (rice)
protocol_references.use: Template for CRISPR targeted insertion strategy and performance benchmarks

protocol_references.title: Plant dual-color luciferase reporter characterization
protocol_references.use: Reporter assay design and normalization strategy in plants

protocol_references.title: Dual luciferase assay in higher plants
protocol_references.use: Plant-specific transient reporter assay precedent

protocol_references.title: Insulator/MAR impact on transgene accumulation in plants
protocol_references.use: Candidate boundary-element rationale for position-effect mitigation

handoff_package_for_lab: Candidate safe-harbor coordinates and locus-screening rationale
Donor cassette maps (+/- insulators) and guide designs
Insertion-junction PCR and copy-number qPCR assays
Dual-luciferase plate map and normalization SOP
Expression stability analysis template (T0 and T1)

experiments.title: Functional Validation of Viral Type 2 IRES-Ribosome Interactions via Translation Assays
experiments.maps_to_problem_statement: Lack of complementary biochemical validation for the structural findings of viral Type 2 IRES recruitment to ribosomal preinitiation complex
experiments.maps_to_sub_question: Do the structural observations correlate with functional translation activity in cellular or in vitro systems?
experiments.objective: Correlate structural observations of IRES-ribosome contacts with functional translation activity using in vitro and cellular reporter assays with site-directed IRES mutants.
readouts: Primary: Relative luciferase activity (firefly/renilla ratio) from bicistronic reporter constructs in mammalian cells, normalized to wild-type IRES
Secondary: In vitro translation efficiency measured by luciferase luminescence from rabbit reticulocyte lysate reactions with mutant vs wild-type IRES constructs
Secondary: Ribosome binding affinity (Kd values) determined by fluorescence polarization or biolayer interferometry for mutant vs wild-type IRES with 40S ribosomal subunits

design.overview: Generate 8-12 site-directed IRES mutants targeting structurally-observed ribosome contact residues, then measure translation efficiency in parallel using dual-luciferase bicistronic reporters in HeLa cells and in vitro translation systems to establish structure-function relationships.
work_packages: WP1: Design and generate IRES mutants (weeks 1-3) - identify 8-12 residues/domains from structural data making ribosome contacts, design mutations (alanine scanning, charge reversals, deletions), clone into bicistronic vectors (HCV-IRES, EMCV-IRES, or target Type 2 IRES) between renilla and firefly luciferase ORFs, sequence-verify all constructs

WP2: Cellular translation assays (weeks 4-7) - transfect HeLa and HEK293T cells with wild-type and mutant bicistronic reporters, harvest at 24h and 48h, measure dual-luciferase activity, perform dose-response with 3 plasmid concentrations, include cap-dependent translation control constructs

WP3: In vitro translation and binding assays (weeks 6-10) - transcribe IRES-firefly constructs in vitro, perform translation in rabbit reticulocyte lysate and wheat germ extract systems, measure time-course luciferase activity, purify 40S subunits from HeLa cells, perform fluorescence polarization binding assays with fluorescein-labeled IRES RNAs

WP4: Data integration and validation (weeks 11-12) - statistical analysis of all translation data, correlation analysis between structural contact distances and functional defects, Western blotting to confirm equal protein loading in cellular assays, RNA stability assays (Northern blot or RT-qPCR) to exclude RNA folding defects
controls: Positive control: Wild-type IRES sequence in bicistronic reporter, expected firefly/renilla ratio of 0.5-2.0 depending on IRES type
Negative control: Bicistronic construct with no IRES (empty intercistronic spacer), expected firefly/renilla ratio <0.05, validates no cap-dependent reinitiation or cryptic IRES activity
Cap-dependent control: Monocistronic firefly luciferase under CMV promoter to normalize for transfection efficiency and general translation capacity
RNA stability control: Mutations in non-contact regions predicted by structure to have no ribosome interaction, should maintain wild-type translation levels
design.sample_size_plan: N=6 biological replicates per construct in cellular assays (3 independent transfections × 2 time points), N=4 technical replicates per construct in vitro translation assays, N=3 technical replicates for binding assays with triplicate measurements each
success_criteria: At least 50% of mutations targeting direct ribosome contact residues (as identified by <5Å distance in structure) show >2-fold reduction in translation efficiency with p<0.01 vs wild-type
Correlation coefficient r>0.6 between structural contact surface area (Å²) and functional translation defect (fold-change) across all mutants
Mutations in non-contact control regions maintain >70% of wild-type translation activity, and RNA stability >80% of wild-type by Northern blot or RT-qPCR
In vitro and cellular assay results show concordance with Pearson r>0.5 for mutant phenotypes

materials.purpose: Primary readout for cellular translation efficiency from bicistronic reporters
Cloning backbone for IRES insertion between renilla and firefly luciferase genes
Generation of site-directed IRES mutations targeting ribosome contact residues
In vitro translation system for measuring IRES activity independent of cellular context
Alternative in vitro translation system to validate findings across different lysate sources

materials.item: HeLa S3 ribosome pellet or 40S purification kit
materials.purpose: Source of mammalian 40S ribosomal subunits for direct binding assays
In vitro transcription of IRES RNA constructs for translation and binding assays
Labeling IRES RNAs for fluorescence polarization binding assays
Primary cell line for cellular translation reporter assays
Secondary cell line to validate translation phenotypes across cell types
Transfection reagent for bicistronic reporter plasmids
Alternative label-free method for measuring IRES-ribosome binding kinetics
Immobilization of biotinylated IRES RNA for binding measurements
RNA stability analysis to ensure mutations don't destabilize IRES transcripts
Plate format for high-throughput dual-luciferase measurements
Luminescence detection for luciferase assays and fluorescence polarization

estimated_direct_cost_usd.scope: Includes molecular biology reagents (cloning, mutagenesis, transcription kits), translation lysates, luciferase assay kits for ~200 assays, cell culture reagents, RNA labeling, and binding assay consumables. Excludes equipment purchases (assumes access to plate reader and BLItz system), labor costs, sequencing fees ($150/construct), and ribosome purification if done commercially (~$2000). High estimate includes BLItz biosensors and commercial 40S subunit purchase.

protocol_references.title: Dual-Luciferase Reporter Assay: An Advanced Co-Reporter Technology Integrating Firefly and Renilla Luciferase Assays (Promega Technical Manual #TM040)
protocol_references.use: Standard protocol for bicistronic reporter assay optimization, normalization procedures, and troubleshooting guidelines for IRES-mediated translation measurements

protocol_references.title: Jaafar et al. 2016, 'Structural Insights into mRNA Reading Frame Regulation by tRNA Modification and Slippery Codon-Anticodon Pairing' eLife, RNA binding and in vitro translation methods
protocol_references.use: Detailed protocols for in vitro translation optimization with different IRES elements and validation of translation initiation vs elongation defects

protocol_references.title: Ochs et al. 2012, 'Assaying Viral IRES Activity' Methods in Molecular Biology 867:271-283
protocol_references.use: Best practices for Type 2 IRES functional analysis including construct design, appropriate controls, and interpretation of bicistronic reporter data

protocol_references.title: Pisarev et al. 2008, 'Specific functional interactions of nucleotides at key -3 and +4 positions flanking the initiation codon with components of the mammalian 48S translation initiation complex' Genes Dev, ribosome binding assay protocols
protocol_references.use: Methods for purifying mammalian 40S subunits and performing quantitative ribosome-RNA binding measurements using fluorescence-based approaches

protocol_references.title: Fukushi et al. 2001, 'Ribosomal protein S5 interacts with the internal ribosomal entry site of hepatitis C virus' JBC 276:20824-20826
protocol_references.use: Fluorescence polarization binding assay protocols adapted for IRES-ribosome interactions with calculation of dissociation constants

handoff_package_for_lab: Structural coordinates (PDB file or CryoEM map) with annotated ribosome-IRES contact residues identified at <5Å, <8Å, and <10Å distance thresholds, including contact surface area calculations and list of 12-15 candidate residues for mutagenesis prioritized by contact type (base-specific, backbone, protein contacts)

Complete wild-type IRES sequence (nucleotides) with secondary structure annotation, domain boundaries, and functional elements identified in literature, formatted for direct cloning into pRF vector between renilla and firefly luciferase genes with appropriate restriction sites or Gibson assembly overhangs

Mutagenesis strategy document specifying: (1) 8-12 target positions with rationale based on structural contacts, (2) specific mutations for each position (e.g., single nucleotide changes, small deletions, charge reversals), (3) 2-3 negative control mutations in non-contact regions, (4) predicted impact on RNA secondary structure using RNAfold or similar tool

Cell culture protocols including validated transfection conditions for HeLa and HEK293T cells with the specific bicistronic vector system, optimal plasmid amounts, and harvest timepoints from preliminary experiments or literature

Data analysis template with pre-defined normalization methods (firefly/renilla ratio calculation, fold-change relative to wild-type, statistical tests for N=6 replicates), correlation analysis pipeline for structure-function relationships, and figure templates for publication

experiments.title: Transcriptomic Profiling of Pachytene-Specific Gene Activation in Meiotic Cells
experiments.maps_to_problem_statement: The concept of 'pachytene genome activation' (PGS) is introduced without proper characterization of which genes are activated, what defines this process, or what mechanisms underlie it
experiments.maps_to_sub_question: What is the complete set of genes that are specifically upregulated during pachytene stage (pachytene genome activation)?
experiments.objective: To identify and validate the complete set of genes specifically upregulated during the pachytene stage of meiosis through temporal RNA-seq profiling across meiotic progression.
readouts: Primary: Differential gene expression profiles across meiotic stages (leptotene, zygotene, pachytene, diplotene) identifying pachytene-upregulated genes (fold-change ≥2, FDR<0.05)
Secondary: RT-qPCR validation of top 20 pachytene-enriched candidates showing stage-specific expression patterns
Secondary: RNA in situ hybridization of 5 representative pachytene-specific genes confirming cellular localization and temporal expression

design.overview: Purify staged meiotic spermatocytes from mouse testes using FACS-based separation (DNA content and surface markers), perform RNA-seq on biological quadruplicates per stage, and validate candidates through orthogonal methods.
work_packages: WP1: Optimize and perform FACS-based isolation of meiotic stages (leptotene, zygotene, pachytene, diplotene) from juvenile mouse testes using Hoechst/surface marker staining; quality control by cytology and stage-specific marker RT-qPCR

WP2: Extract RNA, perform quality control (RIN>8), prepare libraries and sequence (150bp paired-end, 50M reads/sample) for 4 biological replicates per meiotic stage plus pre-meiotic spermatogonia control
WP3: Validate top 20 pachytene-enriched genes by RT-qPCR across all stages (technical triplicates) and perform RNA-FISH on testis sections for 5 representative genes across 3 biological replicates
WP4: Bioinformatic analysis including read alignment, differential expression (DESeq2), clustering, Gene Ontology enrichment, and motif analysis of pachytene-specific promoters
controls: Positive control: Known pachytene-expressed genes (e.g., Spo11, Dmc1, Sycp1) should show expected expression patterns
Negative control: Pre-meiotic spermatogonia sample to establish baseline and identify meiosis-specific vs pachytene-specific genes
Technical control: ERCC spike-in controls for RNA-seq normalization and batch effect assessment across libraries
design.sample_size_plan: 4 biological replicates per stage (5 stages total = 20 RNA-seq samples); RT-qPCR validation on 3 independent biological replicates with 3 technical replicates each; RNA-FISH on 3 biological replicate animals with 10 sections per animal
success_criteria: Identify ≥100 genes with pachytene-specific upregulation (≥2-fold vs all other stages, FDR<0.05) with clear stage separation in PCA analysis
RT-qPCR validation confirms pachytene enrichment for ≥80% of tested candidates (≥1.5-fold vs adjacent stages, p<0.05)
RNA-FISH demonstrates pachytene-stage localized expression for ≥4 of 5 tested genes with signal in >70% of pachytene cells

materials.purpose: Source of enriched meiotic cells at synchronized stages
DNA staining for FACS-based cell cycle staging
Surface marker for excluding undifferentiated spermatogonia
RNA extraction from FACS-purified cell populations
RNA quality control and RIN assessment

materials.item: NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit
materials.purpose: Strand-specific RNA-seq library preparation
Technical controls for normalization and quality assessment
High-throughput paired-end RNA sequencing
cDNA synthesis for RT-qPCR validation
RT-qPCR quantification of validation candidates

materials.item: RNAscope Multiplex Fluorescent Reagent Kit v2
materials.purpose: RNA in situ hybridization for spatial validation
Target-specific probes for pachytene gene visualization
Immunofluorescence co-staining to identify pachytene cells for RNA-FISH

estimated_direct_cost_usd.scope: Includes animals, FACS reagents, RNA extraction, library prep, sequencing (20 samples at institutional rates ~$400/sample), RT-qPCR reagents and primers, RNA-FISH probes and kits. Excludes personnel, equipment access fees, and computational infrastructure.

protocol_references.title: Bastos et al. (2005) Flow cytometric characterization of viable meiotic and postmeiotic cells by Hoechst 33342 in mouse spermatogenesis. Cytometry A 65:40-49
protocol_references.use: Established protocol for FACS-based separation of meiotic stage spermatocytes using DNA content and staining patterns

protocol_references.title: Soumillon et al. (2013) Cellular source and mechanisms of high transcriptome complexity in the mammalian testis. Cell Rep 3:2179-2190
protocol_references.use: Reference transcriptomic approach for meiotic cell profiling and computational methods for stage-specific gene identification

protocol_references.title: Green et al. (2018) Comprehensive roadmap of murine spermatogenesis defined by single-cell RNA-seq. Dev Cell 46:651-667
protocol_references.use: Benchmark dataset for known stage-specific marker genes and validation of pachytene cell identity

protocol_references.title: Wang et al. (2012) RNAscope: a novel in situ RNA analysis platform for formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tissues. J Mol Diagn 14:22-29
protocol_references.use: RNA-FISH protocol for sensitive detection and spatial localization of pachytene-specific transcripts

handoff_package_for_lab: Detailed FACS gating strategy document with representative plots showing separation of leptotene, zygotene, pachytene, and diplotene populations based on DNA content and forward/side scatter parameters
Complete list of validated primer sequences for 10 known stage-specific marker genes (2-3 per stage) to be used for quality control of sorted populations prior to RNA-seq

Bioinformatics pipeline specification including: reference genome version (e.g., mm10/GRCm38), alignment software (STAR v2.7+), differential expression package (DESeq2), cutoffs for defining pachytene-specific genes (statistical and fold-change thresholds), and clustering approach for temporal pattern analysis
Animal breeding schedule to ensure availability of 4 cohorts of day 18-20 juvenile mice (minimum 6 males per cohort) at 2-week intervals for biological replicates
